column1: The Pit Room////The chicken was rich and decadent and the brisket was fatty and just melted on the tongue. I was super surprised when asked light or dark meat chicken and was given a leg instead of it pulled.  The elote was good
column2: but the corn itself was kinda dry (the actual kernels. This place does not skimp on the delicious toppings.) The sautéed green beans were done up with butter
column3: onions and garlic. Just dripping in butter.
